page.title: 04INDUSTRY IN BELFAST
page.content: Fisher Body is the name of a large firm on the outskirts of Belfast. It is a subsidary of General Motors, the United States Car Firm. It has been in N.I. since 1979.It makes good quality car accessories such as seat belts, window regulators, knobs and handles. The factory covers 28 acres and has room for expansion if neccesary.The firm employs 1000 people, over half of whom are women. Production is carried on 24's a day in three eight hour shifts. General Motors chose the site in Dundonald, 5 miles from Belfast, because the plant was already established,having formerly been occupied by Rolls Royce. Fisher Body is one of the few factories in Dundonald which supplies employment.
